result.execSummary:
The defendant Deandre D Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deandre D Rogers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Deandre D Rogers was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deandre D Rogers is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Deandre D Rogers was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Deandre D Rogers was found guilty of Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Deandre D Rogers was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Deandre D Rogers was found guilty of Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Deandre D Rogers was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Deandre D Rogers was found guilty of Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with attached Restitution Worksheet as to victim, Geneva J., filed by ADA Joy Hammond on behalf of the State.

Defendant Deandre D Rogers in court with attorney Richard Voss.  Defendant Deandre D Rogers in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State and defense..

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT 9 MONTHS, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

AS TO COUNT 3:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 15 YEARS, consecutive to Count 4, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 10 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit for 204 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS, consecutive to Count 3, concurrent to any other sentence defendent is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 7:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 15 YEARS, consecutive to Count 8, concurrent to any other sentence the defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 10 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit for 204 days times served.

AS TO COUNT 8:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS, consecutive to Count 7, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 9:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT 9 MONTHS, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

.
  
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims.
* No contact with the co-actors.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $820.00 to the victim, Theresa R.  The Court ordered that the restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,264.99 to the victim, Geneva J. (ref. case# 14CM1818).  The Court ordered that the restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  (DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Defendant Deandre D Rogers in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Deandre D Rogers IN CUSTODY.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense objects.
Arguments heard.
Court GRANTS State's motion to adjourn the sentencing phase, however, this will be the only adjournment allowed.
Case adjourned to 10-09-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Deandre D Rogers in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Deandre D Rogers in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court on defense's motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict and Atty. Voss' motion to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.

AS TO DEFENSE'S MOTION FOR JUDGMENT NOT WITHSTANDING THE VERDICT:  Arguments heard.  For reasons as stated on the record, motion is DENIED.

AS TO ATTY. VOSS' MOTION TO WITHDRAW AS COUNSEL FOR THE DEFENDANT:  Statements made.  For reasons as stated on the record, motion is DENIED.

COURT CLARIFIED THE RECORD TODAY:  Court returned the Count numbers for all charges as originally charged in the criminal complaint and information.  
* Court entered upon the record judgment of conviction as to Counts 3, 4, 7, and 8.
* Court entered upon the record judgment of acquittal as to Counts 5 and 6.

Case adjourned to the already scheduled Sentencing Hearing date of 08-14-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
Witness fee request prepared for Teresa R. for 1 appearance will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Probation Department for processing.
Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits; filed.

Defendant Deandre D Rogers in court with attorney Richard L Voss.  Defendant Deandre D Rogers in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

At the hour of 10:33 AM the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict as follows:  Count 1 - GUILTY, Count 2 - GUILTY, Count 3 - NOT GUILTY, Count 4 - NOT GUILTY, Count 5 - GUILTY, and Count 6 - GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict as to Count 1, Count 2, Count 5, and Count 6 AND denied defense's "oral" motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court will entertain a written motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict by the defense to be heard on the next court date.  

Court GRANTS motion for aquittal as to Count 3 and Count 4.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

**Court, on its own motion, ordered a Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) with a recommendation.

  (DEFENDANT REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Court finds good cause to adjourn the sentencing phase.

Defendant Deandre D Rogers in court with attorney Richard L Voss.  Defendant Deandre D Rogers in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court on defense's 6 motions in limine.

As to defense's General Motion in Limine AND Motion to Exclude Evidence:  Defense's general Motion in Limine AND Motion to Exclude Evidence argued and DENIED.

As to Defendant's Motion in Limine (Friends and Associates of Defendant), Defendant's Motion in Limine (Alleged Witness Intimidation), Defendant's Motion in Limine (Police Informants), Defendant's Motion in Limine (Other Cases-Other Acts), and Defendant's Motion in Limine (Photographs):  Motions are GRANTED.

Case adjourned to 06-23-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Jury Trial.
Defendant's Motion in Limine (Alleged Witness Intimidation) filed by Atty. Richard Voss.
Motion to Exclude Evidence filed by Atty. Richard Voss on behalf of the defendant.
OFFER TO STIPULATE filed by Atty. Richard Voss on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Deandre D Rogers in court with attorney Richard L Voss.  Defendant Deandre D Rogers in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**Defendant enters a PARTIAL PLEA today.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 9:  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed outright.

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, & 8:  Final Pretrial Conference held.  Parties request a motion hearing date as to Defense's Motion to Exclude Evidence.  Court GRANTS request.  Case adjourned to 06-20-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Motion to Exclude Evidence Hearing.  Case remains calendared for a #1 Jury Trial on 06-23-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Deandre D Rogers in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Deandre D Rogers in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty AS TO COUNTS 1 & 9.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
